cover.tagline: Fresh ingredients. Real food. No processed junk.
cover.tagline2: Fuel your runs the natural way.

philosophy.title: My Philosophy
philosophy.quote: Real food doesn't have ingredients. Real food IS ingredients.
philosophy.intro1: As athletes, we often get caught up in the latest supplements, energy gels, and performance products. But the truth is simpler: your body performs best when fueled by real, whole foods.
philosophy.intro2: This cookbook is built on a fundamental belief: fresh ingredients, prepared simply, will always outperform processed alternatives. Every recipe here uses ingredients you can recognize, pronounce, and find at your local market.
philosophy.intro3: No artificial colors. No mystery powders. No ingredient lists that read like chemistry experiments. Just food—the way nature intended.
philosophy.bottomMessage: Food is fuel. Make it count.
philosophy.bottomMessage2: Your performance starts in the kitchen.

howToUse.title: How to Use This Book
howToUse.intro: Each recipe is designed to fuel your training. Here's how to get the most out of this cookbook.
howToUse.categoryTagsDesc: Quick reference for meal type and nutritional profile
howToUse.ingredientsDesc: Fresh, whole foods with simple substitutions when available
howToUse.preparationDesc: Clear instructions from start to finish
howToUse.coachNotesDesc: Tips for timing, variations, and storage
howToUse.goldenRuleText: Never try new foods on race day. Test everything during training first. Your stomach will thank you!

nutrition.title: Nutrition Basics
nutrition.subtitle: Fuel your body right for peak performance
nutrition.carbsSources: Oats, rice, potatoes, fruits, whole grain bread, quinoa
nutrition.proteinSources: Eggs, chicken, fish, legumes, yogurt, tofu
nutrition.fatsSources: Avocado, nuts, olive oil, seeds, fatty fish
nutrition.plateCarbs: 50% Carbs — Your main energy source for training
nutrition.bottomTipText: These are guidelines, not rules. Adjust based on your training intensity, body weight, and how you feel.

mealPlanner.title: Weekly Meal Planner
mealPlanner.mealPrepTip: Batch cook on Sunday for the week ahead

breakfast.name: Breakfast
breakfast.description: Start your day with energy-packed morning meals
breakfast.tip: Eat 2-3 hours before morning training for best digestion

lunch.name: Lunch
lunch.description: Balanced midday meals to keep you fueled
lunch.tip: Include complex carbs to sustain afternoon energy levels

dinner.name: Dinner
dinner.description: Recovery-focused meals to end your day right
dinner.tip: Prioritize protein for overnight muscle repair

snacks.name: Snacks
snacks.description: Quick bites to keep energy steady between meals
snacks.tip: Great for pre-workout fuel or afternoon energy boost

energy-bars.name: Energy Bars
energy-bars.description: Portable, homemade fuel for training and races
energy-bars.tip: Make a batch on weekends for the week ahead

pre-race.name: Pre-Race
pre-race.description: Easy-to-digest meals for race day preparation
pre-race.tip: Stick to familiar foods—never try anything new on race day

post-workout.name: Post-Workout
post-workout.description: Recovery meals to refuel within the golden window
post-workout.tip: Aim for a 3:1 carb-to-protein ratio within 30 minutes

hydration.name: Hydration
hydration.tip: Hydration starts the day before your workout or race

base.name: Bases & Staples
base.description: Foundational recipes for breads, doughs, and spreads
base.tip: Prep these on weekends to use throughout the week

info.name: Tips & Info
info.description: Helpful cooking tips and nutritional information
info.tip: Knowledge is power—understanding food helps you fuel better

timing.nightBeforeDesc: Complex carbs, familiar foods, easy to digest
timing.preWorkoutDesc: 2-3h before: light carbs, low fat, low fiber
timing.raceWeekDesc: Nothing new! Stick to tested favorites

freshFirst.title: Fresh First
freshFirst.description: Whole vegetables, fruits, and proteins form the foundation of every recipe. The closer to its natural state, the better.

noProcessed.title: No Processed Junk
noProcessed.description: We skip the ultra-processed foods, artificial sweeteners, and chemical additives. Your body deserves better fuel.

performanceFocused.title: Performance Focused
performanceFocused.description: Every recipe is designed with athletes in mind—optimal macros, proper timing, and nutrients that support training and recovery.

simpleToMake.title: Simple to Make
simpleToMake.description: You're busy training. These recipes are practical, with accessible ingredients and straightforward preparation.

sustainable.title: Sustainably Minded
sustainable.description: Eating whole foods means less packaging, less waste, and a smaller environmental footprint.

delicious.title: Actually Delicious
delicious.description: Healthy doesn't mean boring. These recipes prove that nutritious food can—and should—taste amazing.
